alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; De Soto; Red River (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 03 at 5:32PM CDT until June 03 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Bienville Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Southern Bossier Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Southern Caddo Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northeastern De Soto Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northwestern Red River Parish in northwestern Louisiana... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 532 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Mansfield, Haughton, Greenwood, Stonewall, Fosters, Eastwood, Robson, Forbing, Taylortown, Frierson, Elm Grove, Sligo, Barksdale Air Force Base, Caspiana, Mc Dade, Keithville, Ferguson and Kingston. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; De Soto; Red River
